intro: Galatella nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered galatella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Galatella nudiflora is often found in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to thrive in humid environments.
